titleStmt.title: Englands Threnodie. Or A briefe and homely discoverie of some jealousies and grievances, under which the kingdom at present groaneth; affectionately tendred by Lady Anglia, to all her dear children, the lovers of their country, and well-willers to truth and peace : especially to her worthy sons, the members of both Houses of Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Ross, Alexander, 1591-1654.

titleStmt.title: Englands Threnodie. Or A briefe and homely discoverie of some jealousies and grievances, under which the kingdom at present groaneth; affectionately tendred by Lady Anglia, to all her dear children, the lovers of their country, and well-willers to truth and peace : especially to her worthy sons, the members of both Houses of Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Ross, Alexander, 1591-1654.

notesStmt.note: A poem, signed at end: A.R. (i.e. Alexander Ross).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
